main.gol.controller

Class GUIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.gol.controller.GUIController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class GUIController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The GUIController class contains a series of functions that handles the GUI-elements and their actionEvents to make the application do what its supposed to do.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        This method is overridden from initializable interface. Spits out the the default gameBoard and initialize the observable GUI components, and instantiates needed objects for controller handling.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - java..net.URL
        resources - java.util.ResourceBundle

      • loadFileFromDisk

        public void loadFileFromDisk()
        EventHandler "Open File" menu-button. Sets a new board by selecting a file, parsing it to the correct decoder and creating a new board.

      • loadFileFromURL

        public void loadFileFromURL()
        EventHandler "Open URL" menu-button. Sets a new board by getting the URL you type, parsing it to the correct decoder and creating a new board.

      • nextStep

        public void nextStep()
              throws javafx.scene.media.MediaException
        EventHandler: "Next" button. Draw the next generation of cells(no animation).
        Throws:
        javafx.scene.media.MediaException - me

      • reset

        public void reset()
        EventHandler: "Reset" button. Stop animation and clear the editor-window of living cells. Reset settings to default and play a oneshot fx sound.

      • handleTheBomber

        public void handleTheBomber()
        EventHandler: "Bomb Icon" button. Fills the Board with random live cells to simulate a MadManPacMan sorta game."Cell consumer".

      • flipZoom

        public void flipZoom()
        Event Handler "Zoom icon". Flip max/min zoom values.

      • flipSpeed

        public void flipSpeed()
        Event Handler: "Speed icon". Flip max/min animation rate

      • handleMouseEvent

        public void handleMouseEvent(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        EventHandler:

        This method handle Cell coordinates of canvas by mouseEvents and the Logic of placing cells correct on the screen and sceneGraph node canvas.

        Draw, erase, and toggle cells in editor by MouseGestures:

        Drag: Draw cells. LeftClick : Toggle Cell alive / Dead. DoubleClick (Hold button and Move support): Erase one or multiple Cells.

        Parameters:
        event - MouseEvent

      • setCellColor

        public void setCellColor()
        EventHandler: "ColorPicker Cell". Set cell-color from ColorPicker.

      • setGridColor

        public void setGridColor()
        EventHandler: "ColorPicker Grid". Set grid-color from ColorPicker.

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor()
        EventHandler: "ColorPicker: Background". Set background-color from ColorPicker.

      • setRandomColor

        public void setRandomColor()
        EventHandler: "Random color" menu-button. Set random colors to Cells, GridLine and Background.

      • resetColor

        public void resetColor()
        EventHandler: "Reset color" menu-button. Reset all colors to default settings.

      • showFileInfo

        public void showFileInfo()
        EventHandler: "FileInfo". Shows the dialog box with the loaded file information.

      • showInfo

        public void showInfo()
        EventHandler: "Info" menu-button. Show information dialog box when info button is clicked.

      • aboutGameOfLife

        public void aboutGameOfLife()
        EventHandler: "About Game Of Life" menu-button. Show information dialog box with Game of Life rules and description.

      • howToPlay

        public void howToPlay()
        EventHandler: "How to play" menu-button. "Show information dialog box about how to play the game.

      • quit

        public void quit()
        EventHandler: "Quit" menu-button". Exit the application.
